words.w: And a feminine noun is referred to by the pronoun هِيَ whether it denotes a human being, an animal or a thing. e.g.
Most feminine nouns end with a round ta (ة) but there are some which do not have any ending.

a. We have learn that the tanwin is the indefinite article, e.g. بَيْتٌ a house. The rule does not apply to proper nouns. So حَامِدٌ is just "hamid", not "a hamid".

b. Feminine proper nouns have no tanwin, e.g. فَاطِمَةُ،  زَزْنَبُ،  آمِنَةُ
